entry.title: Chen Xiaocui (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chen Xiaocui (pictured) helped to translate Sherlock Holmes into Chinese when she was still a child?

entry.title: Rap Pages (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a US$6 plastic crown worn by the Notorious B.I.G. in a photograph featured on the cover of Rap Pages sold for US$594,790 at an auction?

entry.title: Randy Huntington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Randy Huntington coached three athletes to break world records in the long jump, the triple jump, and the 60-metres split?

entry.title: Goody Goody Gum Drops (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite a mathematical model deeming the ice cream bar flavour Goody Goody Gum Drops impossible, it was still created?

entry.title: Mai Fujisawa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a song from Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind was performed by four-year-old Mai Fujisawa, daughter of the film's composer Joe Hisaishi?

entry.title: Harlem Park Three (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Harlem Park Three were awarded US$48 million, the largest sum in Baltimore history, after being falsely imprisoned for murder?

entry.title: Warren C. Dickerson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Warren C. Dickerson helped transform the Bronx into an urban extension of Manhattan?

entry.title: extra heavy crude (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Batman has extra heavy crude?
